Glad that this has happened. If we have learned anything over the past 1.5 years it is that we are all interconnected and what happens in one part of the world affects us all. 

The fight against #COVID19 requires everyone to come together for the good of humanity. https://t.co/UXGvN1IZFJ

I have been saying they needed to do this all week given the #IndiaCovidCrisis 

Glad they decided to have local lockdowns. The way to stop cases from skyrocketing further at this point is to prevent onward transmission,  reduce mobility, and endorse public health measures. https://t.co/eBbUXMdyDm

I too have been seeing people only getting one dose of the #CovidVaccine and this is concerning. 

Remember people, the studies on efficacy are with BOTH doses of the vaccine. https://t.co/vkrzsRnRVn

@KarSar13 @paimadhu @zchagla @VidyaKrishnan @PrakashLab @celinegounder @netshrink @SonaliVaid @Seth_Bhavna @vineet_chopra @ananya_tb @SabiVM There is no randomized controlled data showing that #Favipiravir (Fabiflu) is effective against #COVID19. Unfortunately people hear ancedotal stories of "success" or listen to things they hear and then become frantic trying to find the medication despite no good evidence
@iPreetBrar @paimadhu @zchagla The management of DVT/PE + COVID-19 would need anticoagulation and depend on what resources and meds available. I would defer to a hematologist
